full_history.content: For cast-in-place concrete frame construction in critical facilities under the Virginia Building Code, what are the specific requirements for connecting floor slabs to supporting beams?

I cannot provide a complete answer to the query regarding the specific requirements for connecting floor slabs to supporting beams in cast-in-place concrete frame construction in critical facilities under the Virginia Building Code.  While the provided context points to relevant chapters in the code (Chapter 19 - CONCRETE and Chapter 16 - STRUCTURAL DESIGN), it does not contain the *content* of those chapters aside from a list of sections within them.  Crucially, the specific requirements for connecting floor slabs to beams, especially concerning embedment lengths, reinforcement details, and design considerations for load transfer, are missing.  Furthermore, the definition of a "critical facility" under the Virginia Building Code is also absent.

To provide a complete answer, I need the actual text of the relevant sections within Chapters 16 and 19 of the Virginia Building Code, including any referenced standards like ACI 318, as well as the definition of a "critical facility."  This information is necessary to determine if there are additional requirements for such facilities compared to standard construction.
